sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
By the Lord Deputy, Chief Governour and General of His Majesties Army in Ireland. A declaration Tyrconnel. Whereas, we find it requisite for His Majesties service, that the forces he is obliged to maintain, for the preservation of the peace of this his kingdom, be kept in good order and discipline: ... Proclamations. 1687-02-24. Ireland. Lord Deputy (1687-1689 : Tyrconnel)
2 sheets (versos only)
printed by Andrew Crooke and Samuel Helsham, assigns of Benjamin Tooke printer to the Kings Most Excellent Majesty; and are to be sold by Andrew Crook at His Majesties printing-house on Ormonde-Key, and by Samuel Helsham at the Colledge-Arms in Castle-Street, [Dublin : 1686. [i.e. 1687]
"Given .. the 24th day of February 1686[/]7". Arms 187; Steele notation: Majesties duly 2) themselves Mili-. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
By the Lord Deputy, Chief Governour and General of His Majesties Army in Ireland. A declaration Tyrconnel. Whereas, we find it requisite for His Majesties service, that the forces he is obliged to maintain, for the preservation of the peace of this his kingdom, be kept in good order and discipline: ... Proclamations. 1687-02-24. Ireland. Lord Deputy (1687-1689 : Tyrconnel)
2 sheets (versos only)
printed by Andrew Crooke and Samuel Helsham, assigns of Benjamin Tooke printer to the Kings Most Excellent Majesty; and are to be sold by Andrew Crook at His Majesties printing-house on Ormonde-Key, and by Samuel Helsham at the Colledge-Arms in Castle-Street, [Dublin : 1686. [i.e. 1687]
"Given .. the 24th day of February 1686[/]7". Arms 187; Steele notation: Majesties duly 2) themselves Mili-. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
the Kings Most Excellent Majesty;
Andrew Crook
Samuel Helsham
Andrew Crooke
Samuel Helsham
Benjamin Tooke
His Majesties printing-house on Ormonde-Key
the Colledge-Arms in Castle-Street
